name: Arabian Park Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is probably just right for a stoppover of 3 days or so. Its clean and well maintained if the rooms are a little dated by Dubai standards but for the money you can't complain.
reviews.title: Good for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes it is a bit remote and you have to take a cab everywhere or the courtesy bus (although it was never running at the times we needed it). A taxi to Dubai Mall only costs around £3.00 and Emirates Mall £8.00.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: Breakfast is palatial though and good quality although I would personally avoid the 9am rush when the restaurant becomes a bit of an assault course lol.
reviews.title: clear hotel

reviews.text: Corridors in the hotel smelt a bit smokey but never saw anyone smoking which was odd!
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: Overall perfectly adequate for a stoppover but probably no for a holiday.
reviews.title: Nice budget hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is small and located little bit far from the center, but there is a metro station near and WaFi centre. Most of all I liked breakfasts, as for 3 stars hotel they are really good, a lot of fruits, juces, meat..... Service in hotel is excelent, there are transfers to WaFi centre, Jumeira beach park, Burj Khalifa. Also they have business cener 24 hours open and a giude who can help you to choose any excursion and tell you everything about local customs if you visit Emirates at the first time. Rooms are clean and have everything you need. As for me it is really "3 stars hotel with 5 stars attitude" (written in hotel's farewall letter )
reviews.title: "3 stars hotel with 5 stars attitude"

reviews.text: The hotel is set a quite far form the city and cabs/ the metro are a must. The hotel is cheap and attracts several tour groups which can make the shared areas very busy and check-in/ out can take take a small amount of time. The hotel offers a good value (though slightly limited range of) food. Having stayed a few times, there is nothing to set this hotel apart, expect the price. Its clean, functional and cheap, it feels very much like an ibis or travel lodge which isn't a bad thing if your on a budget.
reviews.title: Good value Hotel

reviews.text: Arabian Park is a basic 3 star hotel with no frills. I landed a deal for a few days, however, I would not stay there again.
reviews.title: Just the FACTS

reviews.text: The Good; Great service, the folks working the concierge desk are very helpful. The hotel room is average, FREE but somewhat sluggish internet in the 2nd floor lounge.
reviews.title: Xmas in Dubai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad; Location of the hotel is out in the middle of nowhere and I mean NOWHERE, nothing around and it is too far to walk to anywhere of significance. Hotel does offer a shuttle but it is only offered a few times per day and in the evening hailing a cab is a challenge. The closest Metro station is a 12(AED) cab fare about $4 +.
reviews.title: Good value for not to much money

reviews.text: We spend two weeks there and we like it there. Me, hubby and teenaged daughter like the hotel. The studio was very comfortable. Rooms were very clean and tidy. I have never had such a nice and big bed in any other hotel. The staff were very nice, friendly and helpfull.
reviews.title: Nice and clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel had suprisingly fast internet.
reviews.title: Close to airport and too far out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only minus was the water of the pool; it was freezing.
reviews.title: good bargain; will be better when metro stop opens

reviews.text: We will be back for sure.
reviews.title: Enough for our money

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in this hotel and would not stay again. Too far away from the centre dependent on taxis or hotel shuttle to get about. The new 5 mins away metro is not open yet and yet the taxi driver thought it was! The hotel shuttle is not very frequent and the driver is miserable and does not tell you where he is going or stopping. Good views of the city but covered in a haze. Restaurant very poorly managed, gets very crowded in food area when trying to get your food. Hot food is barely warm and not a huge selection. Often food runs out and so do the plates and cutlery! Evening meal ok with good table service. Deli food sandwiches no brown bread and cakes lets you get food all day.
reviews.title: A Great Experience

reviews.text: Excellent hotel apartment, great hospitality and transportation facilities.. All these factors in addition to the clean environment and varied activities have combinated to deliver the perfect vacation to all the family members..
reviews.title: A Splendid Vacation...

reviews.text: Arabian Park Hotel is definitely the place for an unforgettable vacation in Dubai!
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel i stayed at both one night at Arabian Park and one night at Park excellent hotel apartment with good services
reviews.title: Great facilities and friendly service

reviews.text: We caught the shuttle bus from the airport at 2.15am and were pleased to find the reception and coffee bar operating when we arrived at the hotel! The room was fine, airconditioning nice and quiet, shame the window didn't open. Next day I enjoyed a swim in the warm, shallowish saltwater pool, then we took the shuttle bus down to the Wafi Mall. We stayed 2 nights; enjoyed a few coffees from the deli/coffee bar but didn't have breakfast booked or take any other meals in the hotel. I couldn't get my computer connected to the LAN in the room, but the (chargeable) WiFi in the lounge along the corridor by the lifts worked fine.
reviews.title: Stayed in Apartments next to Hotel - good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the best things, was that as there are so few hotels or in fact other buildings in this area yet, all the taxis we hired to get back from town knew the hotel and where to find it.
reviews.title: Value for money, but boring

description: Set in 4 acreas of Beautiful gardens the Arabian Park Hotel is located just 12 minutes away from the most visited places of Dubai.
